Yes, in fact Trump has impressed me greatly in the last few months. Trump’s handling of the corona virus crisis has encouraged me to believe that he has the ability to take on anything the Presidency of the United States could hand him, including an actual shooting war. He has made the hard calls, such as shutting down flights from China, quickly and with no apparent dithering. He has listened to experts and changed his mind, as when he wanted the country to reopen for Easter and then decided that the end of April was safer. And he has appointed good people to do difficult jobs, and then supported them — Drs. Fauci and Dirx and Rear Admiral John Polowczyk are examples. There are hundreds of other examples of excellent leadership that the country has witnessed over the last few months. Trump has built up a lot of credibility among even Democratic governors for his willingness to work to keep the American people safe, no matter what their political leanings. Despite the cavils of the liberal media, President Trump has done an excellent job of handling the response to the COVID-19 pandemic, and I, among others, have noticed.

Yes. He initially tried to keep people calm while they assessed the situation and organized their response. He has then kept people informed every step of the way while trying to balance the larger issues of our long term economic stability with the shorter term goals of slowing the spread of the virus and saving as many lives as possible. Failure to balance all those interests would cost far more lives in the long term and threaten the fundamental well being of our nation and way of life going forward. As a mere human being, he has done an exceptional job of putting together a team of experts and maintaining that careful balance while keeping the American people well informed and reassured going forward.
